Data Structures | Macros | Typedefs | Enumerations | Functions
USB Functionality
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides comprehensive USB functionality for Apollo5 devices, supporting USB device operations, endpoint management, data transfer, and PHY configuration. It enables USB communication for applications requiring host connectivity and data exchange capabilities.

Key Features

  1. Device Operations: USB device initialization and management.
  2. Endpoint Management: Endpoint configuration and control.
  3. Data Transfer: Support for DMA, ADMA, and PIO data transfers.
  4. PHY Configuration: USB PHY tuning and clock source selection.
  5. Interrupt Handling: USB interrupt service routines and callbacks.

Functionality

  • Initialize and deinitialize USB device
  • Configure endpoints and transfer modes
  • Manage USB power and PHY clock
  • Handle USB interrupts and callbacks
  • Support DMA and ADMA transfers

Usage

  1. Initialize USB using am_hal_usb_initialize()
  2. Configure endpoints with am_hal_usb_ep_init()
  3. Manage power and clock with am_hal_usb_power_control() and am_hal_usb_phy_clock_enable()
  4. Handle data transfers using am_hal_usb_ep_xfer()
  5. Register callbacks for USB events

Configuration

  • Configure endpoint attributes and buffer sizes
  • Set PHY tuning parameters and clock sources
  • Enable/disable double buffering for endpoints
  • Register event and transfer completion callbacks

USB State

For Apollo5, the USB controller is sending STATUS stage ACK automatically when DATA stage of CONTROL_TRANSFER is completed.

This flag states whether USB Stack (and its porting) that controls the USB HAL will explicitly trigger a zero-length transaction during STATUS stage as indication of STATUS stage ACK.

If the USB stack does not issue zero-length transaction during STATUS stage, enable the #define AM_HAL_USB_CTRL_XFR_AUTO_STATUS_STATE_ACK below.

Note: This selection is only here for compatibility between HAL and Stack. The USB controller will send STATUS ACK to USB Host regardless of the selection.

#define AM_HAL_MAGIC_USB   0xEA9E06
 
#define AM_HAL_USB_CHK_HANDLE(h)
 
#define AM_HAL_USB_ENTER_CRITICAL   uint32_t __uiIRQEnabled = NVIC_GetEnableIRQ(USB0_IRQn); NVIC_DisableIRQ(USB0_IRQn);
 
#define AM_HAL_USB_EXIT_CRITICAL   if (__uiIRQEnabled) { NVIC_EnableIRQ(USB0_IRQn); }
 

Endpoint Masks

maximum endpoint number is six (EP0 ~ EP5)

#define AM_HAL_USB_EP_MASK   0x3F
 
#define AM_HAL_USB_CHK_EP(n)   ((n & ~AM_HAL_USB_EP_MASK) > 0)
 
#define AM_HAL_USB_CHK_EP_NUM(n)   ((n & 0x7F) > 5)
 
#define AM_HAL_USB_CHK_USB(n)   (n & ~0xF)
 

Endpoint Numbers

Five endpoint number are available except EP0

#define AM_HAL_USB_EP0_NUMBER   0x0
 
#define AM_HAL_USB_EP1_NUMBER   0x1
 
#define AM_HAL_USB_EP2_NUMBER   0x2
 
#define AM_HAL_USB_EP3_NUMBER   0x3
 
#define AM_HAL_USB_EP4_NUMBER   0x4
 
#define AM_HAL_USB_EP5_NUMBER   0x5
 
#define AM_HAL_USB_EP_MAX_NUMBER   AM_HAL_USB_EP5_NUMBER

#define FADDR_Update(pUSB)   (*((volatile uint8_t *)&(pUSB->CFG0)) & USB_CFG0_Update_Msk)

Typedef Documentation

◆ am_hal_usb_dev_evt_callback

typedef void(* am_hal_usb_dev_evt_callback) (am_hal_usb_dev_event_e eDevState)

device event callback function pointer type

Upper layer USB stack uses it to define a callback function to receive the the USB bus events and registers it by 'am_hal_usb_register_dev_evt_callback' function.

◆ am_hal_usb_ep0_setup_received_callback

typedef void(* am_hal_usb_ep0_setup_received_callback) (uint8_t *pui8Setup)

ep0 setup request callback function pointer type

Upper layer USB stack uses it to define a callback function to receive setup requst from the USB host and registers it by 'am_hal_usb_register_ep0_setup_received_callback' function.

◆ am_hal_usb_ep_xfer_complete_callback

typedef void(* am_hal_usb_ep_xfer_complete_callback) (uint8_t ui8EpAddr, uint32_t ui32XferLen, am_hal_usb_xfer_code_e eXferCode, void *param)

ctrl/bulk/intr/iso transfer callback function pointer type

Upper layer USB stack uses it to define a callback function to receive a confirm for the USB HAL driver about how many bytes has been tranfered and the transfer status.

◆ am_hal_usb_ep_clear_stall()

uint8_t ui8EpAddr )

clear the endpoint stall

Parameters
pHandle- handle for the module instance.
ui8EpAddr- endpoint address including the endpoint direction

This function is used by upper layer USB stack to clear the endpoint stall when USB device stack can recovry from some error status or USB host sends the clear feature request to clear the stall of the endpoint.

Returns

Parameters

◆ am_hal_usb_phy_clock_enable()

uint32_t am_hal_usb_phy_clock_enable ( void * pHandle,
bool bEnable,
am_hal_usb_dev_speed_e eSpeed )

turn on/off USB PHY reference clock

Parameters
pHandle- the handle of initialized USB instance
eEnable- whether to enable the USB PHY reference clock
eSpeed- USB maximum device speed

This function is used to configure USB PHY reference clock for the USB device speed mode selected by eSpeed.
Note: If AM_HAL_USB_SPEED_HIGH is selected for eSpeed, make sure that the system PLL is configured as USB PHY clock source, and locked before this function is called.

Returns
one of am_hal_status_e like AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS

◆ am_hal_usb_phy_electrical_tuning_set()

uint32_t am_hal_usb_phy_electrical_tuning_set ( uint32_t ui32Module,
am_hal_usb_phy_elec_tuning_param_id_e eParam,
am_hal_usb_phy_elec_tuning_param_val_t * psVal )

Set USB PHY electrical tuning parameters.

Parameters
ui32Module- the index to the USB module
eParam- enum am_hal_usb_phy_elec_tuning_param_id_e that indicates USB PHY electrical tuning parameter to set
psVal- pointer to union am_hal_usb_phy_elec_tuning_param_val_t which contains the value for the tuning parameter.
Note
This API is expected to be called during BSP initialization, before USB instance is initialized. Changes made after the instance initialization will not take effect until a reinitialization.
Returns
one of am_hal_status_e like AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS

◆ am_hal_usb_test_mode()

uint32_t am_hal_usb_test_mode ( const void * pHandle,
const am_hal_usb_test_mode_e eTestMode )
extern

do the USB test

Parameters
pHandle- handle for the module instance.
eTestMode- one of the test mode like TEST_SE0_NAK, TEST_J, TEST_K and TEST_PACKET.

This function is used by upper layer USB stack to order the USB device controller to send the specific USB packet or signals to verify the timing and signal quaility.
